required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fear Among Dentists During COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Fear and Practice Modification Among Dentists During COVID-19 Pandemic

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimed to evaluate the anxiety and fear of infection between dentists working during the present corona virus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic and to explore dentist's knowledge about various practice modifications and guidelines to fight the novel corona virus

detailed_description.textblock:
The spread of corona virus (COVID-19) has posed significant challenges for dentistry and medicine, and dental and medical schools, in all affected countries.
The speed of reaction and type of response to this disease around the world have been very variable according to differing healthcare systems, economies and political ideologies

primary_outcome.measure: fear among dentist during COVID 19 epidemic
primary_outcome.description: measuring unit questionnaire and the measuring unit is categorical yes, no and unaware

secondary_outcome.measure: practice modification among dentist during COVID 19 epidemic
secondary_outcome.description: measuring unit questionnaire and the measuring unit is categorical yes, no and don't know

study_pop.textblock: Dentist having bachelor of dentistry or equivalent degree

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Dentist having bachelor of dentistry or equivalent degree
Exclusion Criteria:
- paramedical staff and dental students

responsible_party.investigator_title: lecturer in pediatric dentistry and dental public health, faculty of dentistry, Cairo university
